known limitations ::

1. Infinite recursion occurs for recursive objects with a ref field of themselves. This is because the bcs format does not account for nil types in ref objects, at least from the sources I have read. So, if you want to use a recursive type. try using it in an Option type or don't use it at all. Until there are changes to the bcs structure

2. Since this library works by means of string operations, and nim strings are implemented as char bytes. This library cannot differenciate between normal strings and hex strings but you can implement one specific for your needs with this library 3 . Because of my understanding on enums in nim, all nim enums are serialized and deserialized as string valued enums. So non string valued enums are not supported. Keep this in mind when interfacing with bcs libraries from other languages

constants, int128, utils
